assignments.name: context
assignments.value:
={{ "You are an expert recruiter. Rank these LinkedIn profiles by how likely they are to respond to a job application outreach for:

Position: " + $json.currentJob.position + "
Company: " + $json.currentJob.company + "
Location: " + $json.currentJob.location + "

Profiles:
" + JSON.stringify($json.employees.map((e, i) => ({
  id: i,
  name: e.fullName || e.name,
  headline: e.headline || e.position,
  location: e.location
}))) + "

Return ONLY a JSON array with this exact format (no markdown, no explanation):
[{"id": 0, "name": "Full Name", "headline": "Position", "score": 9, "reasoning": "Brief reason"}]

Rank by: 1) Role relevance (recruiter/HR=10, hiring manager=7, other=3), 2) Seniority, 3) Location match. Return top " + $json.contactsPerJob + " only." }}

parameters.query: =SELECT email, linkedin_url FROM contacts WHERE user_id = '{{ $json.userId }}'
